website_summaries.verdict: Anyone dealing with wind chill will love this balaclava, which blocks the cold almost perfectly.
pros: This mask laughs at subzero temperatures and freezing winds
Fits snugly yet is very breathable
Face mask can be lowered underneath chin, or hood can be pulled back for increased comfort or cooling
Fits perfectly under a ski helmet
cons: Runs a bit tight around the nose for some wearers

customer_reviews.title: arctic roughnecking
customer_reviews.text: this is my second year working in North dakota on workover rigs. this is by far the best mask I've worn working derricks. high wind and below zero Temps this mask was awesome. I keep a spare in my bag at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yoooooo!
customer_reviews.text: I LOOK LIKE SMOKE FROM MORTAL KOMBAT!!! I LOVE IT!!! Gotta get the green next #Reptile But in all seriousness, I work outside doing commercial hvac/r and it gets beyond cold on those rooftops. I will give an updated performance review next weekend 12/2/17 *EDIT/UPDATE 1/13/18* Ok, so I went a few extra weeks to get a much better trial & I am not disappointed in the least bit, I've had the misfortune of experiencing heavy winds/snow & rain mixtures(upwards of 20mph) on various roofs & this mask withstood the harshest of what was throw at me, it's very durable & I've actually had to take it of just to cool off a few times(that's a plus for me) 5*
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Vandelay

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, breathable
customer_reviews.text: Very useful, breathable. Perfect if you are going to be moving, walking, excersizing etc., but if you plan to be outside without moving too much I would recommend wearing another balaclava or a scarf on top of this one
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It works great, and keeps my whole head and face warm, especially my nose and ears. The only bad thing about it is that it pushes my nose in and I have to constantly pull it out to loosen it a bit. But I'm still giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Dolluxe

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It’s extremely warm and snug fitting! Definitely stretching to fit you big head! It’s not an issue to use it with glasses either! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: McNicholls Boodram

customer_reviews.title: Very warm mask.
customer_reviews.text: I do service work and sometimes I have to go on roofs. It was a cold windy day, my head was warm. I have a good size head it fits pretty good a little tight when first put it on. It came down my neck and tuck it in my shirt. Next year going to get another one to switch out.
customer_reviews.author: P. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: To simulate what this feels like, have someone press down on your nose and ...
customer_reviews.text: I already own a Seirus balaclava. Was buying a backup and saw this brand. Whoa this thing is awful. No doubt it's soft and warm. Unfortunately is SMOOSHES the heck out of your nose! There's no tension relief for the nose. I was uncomfortable trying it on for less than 30 seconds. I couldn't imagine trying to snowboard with this thing on. To simulate what this feels like, have someone press down on your nose and hold it in. Also the cutout for the eye area isn't right. Material rides too close to the bottom edge and corners of your eyes. I'm going back to my Seirus thank you very much. The nose area is soft & flexible neoprene.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very very warm as well I highly recommend buying this it folds back into a face cover ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly. Very very warm as well I highly recommend buying this it folds back into a face cover as well if you don't want the top on!!!👍✌
customer_reviews.author: B.P Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I work outside at night doing fleet fueling and this thing is great. It fits very comfortably and doesn’t impede your vision or range of motion. Over all very satisfied with this product. Also I have a pretty big head and it fits just fine with a little room to spare I wear a size 8 hat if that helps anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Jarimia

customer_reviews.title: Did not realize it was made with flame retardants until ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize it was made with flame retardants until I read the label. Those chemicals are absolutely awful and stay in your body for a long time. Why do I want that on my face, breathing them in? Just wish I had noticed that within the return window.
customer_reviews.author: SJS

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for all
customer_reviews.text: These worked great and one size does fit all my 8 year old 10 year old and my self wore them to snow tube..
customer_reviews.author: Tara Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and fits great. Put chin in the dedicated spit to have a place to orientate the mask to fit appropriately. Only thing I had to do was trim the tag underneath the mask because it was causing my neck to itch.
customer_reviews.author: Nightreign

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well (as many other reviewers have said)! Fogging can be a bit of an issue (with glasses), perhaps try to pull down a bit; it's not always an issue. But in general is very good; you feel the difference from the first moment; keeps you ears, neck nose etc. warm; really works well! You can also pull down the 'face -mask' part to talk to people (or when someone wants to know who you are!). Also, you basically don't need a scarf with this, as it gives you a large covering over the neck area also. Thank you! i can not continues going by bike in freezing weather! (especially the deep freeze we've had on the East Coast recently!
customer_reviews.author: Joe2

customer_reviews.title: Not windproof and not sized well
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT universally sized! It's absolutely humongous! There is no way this will work for me. Also, pay close attention to the wording on the description that claims this is "windproof". The only wind "resistant" part is in the front. The rest of it is fleece material. I find the description of "windproof" to be very deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: BC118

customer_reviews.title: It's works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go to Love land, Colorado and it saved my life lol, it was 0 degrees. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortably disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The material is good, basic fleece that attracts every hair and dust fragment. The nose and mouth area are nice- they extend from the face, let ample breathing air and filter some of the cold out. The fit is disfunctional. The system portion is uncontrollable. It creeps uncomfortably into your lower lids and impairs vision no matter what type of altering I do to its positioning. I also tried glasses which fog and do not hold the thick eye rubbing back, again blocking vision. I am An averaged sized woman; 5’7 and 140. Maybe this should be for a large man?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you!
customer_reviews.text: Great product cheap and does the job for ur few bucks I haul and deliver gasoline in Colorado in extreme cold colder and this little fellow sure keep ur head face and ears warm. Would definitely recommend don't let the price fool you!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Keeps me warm working outside 10 hour days. For the price this thing will surprise you with it's warmth. Just make sure you layer up when the temperature reaches below zero.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stop the fog!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically because it supposedly has this mesh material that "prevents fogging of glasses, and sunglasses", but unless I was wearing it "wrong", it most certainly DID NOT stop my sunglasses from fogging up! I was so pissed because I really need to wear sunglasses, as the bright sun makes me squint, hurting my eyes, and I couldn't wear the sunglasses at all. I will try wearing this again, adjust the positioning maybe, and see if I can change this one star rating; I will definitely update this review if I get better results.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W Earle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Winter Sports + Winter Biking
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to protect my face better when I bike in Minnesota during the winter. I purchased this because It was supposed to be thing material, but warm and windproof. It is all those things. I don't only use this for biking now, but most activities during winter. For snowshoeing, if I get too warm, I can flip the hat back, or pull down the mask, and everything else stays warm. I haven't had any issues with the mask freezing from my breath in sub-zero weather and I was amazed by how warm it kept me when the wind-chill has gotten well below -20F. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Ouch my face
customer_reviews.text: This squeezes the ever lasting life out of my face. It feels like someone is holding a rock and pressing my nose down. It is very painful in the nose area otherwise it'd be fine. I don't have a big nose either I have small features and this still hurt my face. It's too bad because the material is very comfortable they just need to work on the nose piece because it is not comfortable to wear. Unless you don't mind your face being pressed down don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri

customer_reviews.title: This is industry grade face mask
customer_reviews.text: My dad specifically asked for this mask. He works in Kazakhstan for Oil and gas company, temperature there ranges from -15C to -40C during winter period. I bough this and sent it to him. He told me it did the job of covering his face and providing some resistance to that brutal cold weather. I'd recommend this to anyone who has to work in a field surrounded by snow and wind chills. Always wear layers, cover every part of your skin when heading out to such cold temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Vegito_Blue

customer_reviews.title: This mask is made for cold weather only.
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking (like me) to buy this mask as a substitution of a disposable mask, make sure that you live in a place where it is snowing right now, or you have very cold weather because if it is hot you will sweat as heck. So, to use it to go out during Coronavirus time just because you do not find any other type of masks, nope this is not the one. The mask lets you breathe but it is uncomfortable because it keeps moving to your eyes, at least to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible for people who wear glasses and if you’re out in subzero temps. The moisture build up just made my face cold and wet and they don’t dry quickly or whisk moisture away. To make matters worse, if you keep this over your nose & you wear eyeglasses, your glasses will fog up and then frost up in sub zero temperatures. Your glasses will fog up in any other temps and you won’t be able to see.
customer_reviews.author: Jomu

customer_reviews.title: Good with ski goggles too
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done though it’s a bit rigid in the area around the nose and some of the thinner ones can be pulled higher. It is a must for New England winter this year given the cold and windy weather. Good with ski goggles too. It is more breathable then those with solid material around the mouth with nose but thes areas may get colder. I like having this kind and the solid material type for different conditions. The flexibility of taking off the hat part or the mouth part is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Windproof
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as I work construction and I'm always trying to find a way to beat the winter weather. The balaclava works great and keeps my neck head and face warm, my only complaint is that I purchased it on 12/8/16 for $12.49 and on 12/9/16 (the day it shipped) the price dropped $2, so if I would have waited a day to order I would've saved 2 bucks. all in all very happy with the product. It does cause my safety glasses to fog up when I exhale but I've never found a product that doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I can only surmise that there are quality control issues because multiple people complained of it being too large and mine is ridiculously small. I’m smaller than the average woman and don’t have a large head so this is perplexing. The material seems to be warm enough and is probably wind resistant but I can’t get used to feeling claustrophobic long enough to try it outside. I can’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Rising

customer_reviews.title: warm and versitile
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I can easily pull mask up over my nose. It keeps my head warm if I want to cover it. It gets warmer out as I walk, and I pull back the "hood." It covers my throat and neck without choking me.For fall and winter...this will be one of my greatest treasures in this Pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Low

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this item
customer_reviews.text: Considering all that was said on the site about this, I was shocked at how HUGE it is. I mean, maybe Arnold Schwarzenegger would not have problems wearing this thing,but it was not meant for an average woman's head. The nose section is way too big - so large it could cover my eye area and down past my mouth! Basically, it was useless. Look elsewhere for something that fits a real human.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for roleplay!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my guru, he's the love of my life, and we enjoy impact play and startling roleplay. He scared me with this on, and I liked it! Eek! A man! But yes, it's wonderful and it fit him well and it didn't change his voice when he was making a growling sound.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Del Mar - Electronics & Lifestyle Influencer!

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me From Getting Sick
customer_reviews.text: I work in a freezer, sometimes working 8 to 10 hours on a forklift in -5 degrees. This mask isnt enough to do the job on its own, but over a wool mask its a life saver. If you're just using it in a refrigerated area 33-40 degrees it's great on its own too. Pretty breathable so I wouldn't recommend it if theres wind directly blowing in your face, you'll definitely still get cold air assaulting your nose if you dont have anything under it. It's an awesome companion to a wool mask though, even bought it twice.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dominique

customer_reviews.title: and started getting painful windburn and angular cheilitis
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this balaclava for three years. It's life-changing. I bike and walk to work (SW Michigan), and started getting painful windburn and angular cheilitis. With just this hood, no hat, I can only tell it's windy because it's harder to pedal forward. The vent isn't foolproof, my glasses do fog if I'm breathing hard but it's simple to pull under my nose and chin instead or push down around my neck in case of overheating. No more windburn, and it fits easily in a pocket when the day warms up.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Chicago approved
customer_reviews.text: I needed a face mask to protect me from the Chicago winter breeze and I'm so happy I got this! I LOVE the fact that this is hinged at the mouth area. When you have something covering your face in the winter it starts to get moist inside and there's condensation so my face gets wet and I break out. Because of the shape, the fabric doesn't touch my face so I haven't broken out. It's windproof as well and it keeps my face very warm. Even without the hood, the mask part still stays up, so that's definitely an awesome feature about this product. Highly recommend this balaclava!
customer_reviews.author: Maaya Yamauchi

customer_reviews.title: Funny looking?!?
customer_reviews.text: My kids think I look funny in it - well, when we go skiing I'll be the one laughing. Honestly though, the thing has a bit of a weird thing going on right around the chin/mouth area. The fabric sort of bunches up there and puckers outward. You can almost see it in the pictures where it isn't being worn, but when wearing it you can also see it - just not so well in the pictures on the store page. Other than the fabric issue, it provides full coverage for your head/face and you can't really ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Docdra

customer_reviews.title: Would by again.  Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great product. It arrived on time and basically covers your whole head and neck except for your eyes. Does not impede your hearing, or breathing, works with short or very long hair. I used it for an entire day shoveling snow and working outside when it was between 9° and 20° with some wind. I am very pleased with its performance. Just bear in mind that if you wear prescription glasses or sun glasses they do fog up from your breathing. Good product, fair price, would definitely buy again...👍
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: doesn't have to cover your head to be great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use under a motorcycle helmet. At first, I was very disappointed as the thickness of the fabric made the helmet fit just a bit too tight. A month or too later (yeah, I am slow), I realized I could wear this as a gaiter just around my neck. It’s constructed such that you can put your entire head through the face/ eye hole and it’s quite comfortable. Put it on and push the top back onto your nape. It’s GREAT this way, very warm and seals pretty well against the underside of my full face helmet.
customer_reviews.author: David Cole

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my face warm in the winter on my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: I could not ride my motorcycle in the winter without this. It keeps my face, head, and neck very comfortable. It's a little hard to breathe through when standing still, but as soon as you get moving on the bike, it's not a problem anymore. The only issue I have with it is that it tends to direct my breath up to my sun glasses and fogs them up, but I don't think that's enough of an issue to warrant a dropped star. Overall, I've been very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit for me!
customer_reviews.text: The eye opening is perfect! I can even slide my glasses in after putting it on without feeling any extra pressure on them. Kept me warm in the recent snow without needing an extra hat or anything. Love it! Perfect width for the eye opening and flexibility in how you can wear it. My husband bought a draw string one on Amazon that he prefers but it doesn't cover as much as this one. My daughters like a lighter weight one that I bought from "The Friendly Swede" on Amazon but the eye opening wasn't wide enough for me (hit the outside corner edges of my eyes). Love this one! Sooo, out of three different options this is my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Be the ninja you always dreamed of becoming
customer_reviews.text: It does the job it was designed to do. Feels well made, durable plus It's soft, warm and as a bonus it makes you look like a ninja, what more could you ask for. Would buy again and would recommend to anyone, who wants to keep their head face and neck warm.
customer_reviews.author: SlappyWag

customer_reviews.title: Very big
customer_reviews.text: One size fits all is a misnomer with this. I have a pretty decent sized melon and this thing swallows my head. Still have the fogging of my safety glasses when breathing through my nose. It is comfortable though and smooth on my bald head.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Quite good for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Having usually worn a reasonably cheap winter hat, this took a bit of getting used to. The fitting around the eyes and nose are tight - certainly works to keep you as warm as possible, but you may have an issue with it. Very nice to have a mouth covering that is thin enough that you can easily breath through yet thick enough that the cold air doesn't come straight in to freeze your lips off. Overall decently comfortable and keeps me quite warm, even if I often forgo wearing it because it looks like I'm going to rob a bank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for below freezing elements!
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and my son who both work in the oilfields in the below temps..weather..said that this product right here saved their lives! Literally! It's super line material that doesn't make you itchy but works incredibly in the cold elements!! This is a must have for anyone who needs the frost bite to not take over and yet let's your breathe normally. Very thankful for these types of products for the most important men in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Lewis Couch

customer_reviews.title: Keeps face warm Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: This offers good face protection. My biggest issue with this one is that it fogs up my glasses. Which can be very difficult when riding my motor scooter because sometimes I have to pull it down to get the fog off so I see. This made it possible for me to ride outside to work everyday and stay warm. When it gets very cold outside I recommend wearing a scarf around your neck because this will keep your face warm but not your neck.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barclift

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This face mask works well. I was looking for something I could wear to help break the wind while riding my quad during the winter. It works pretty well, however while driving at 25-30 mph the wind will come through the mouth section. It will also fog your glasses up unless you are riding at 10 mph or so. Decent mask for the money and it keeps your head and neck warm
customer_reviews.author: GrimmRoper

customer_reviews.title: Works when it is ICE cold
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing this every day at the Harbin, China Ice Festival, temps down to -15F at night, day highs a "balmy" +15F. Keeps my head and face warm. Can pull it down to cover the ears. Can pull face mask down when it's less cold, pull head covering back and down when going inside. Only when it is REALLY windy do I have to use my parka hood. Otherwise, even down to -15F, this alone is sufficient to keep my top warm. Hang it up to dry at night (as the frozen breath condensation thaws). By morning, it's dry. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: 11bravo

customer_reviews.title: 15mph+
customer_reviews.text: My experience is when you are moving at 15mph+ with wind speed of 10mph+ hitting you in the face these wouldn't be able to provide the proper warmth. If you use these just walking around I believe they would provide a good amount of warmth in 40F degree temperature. These are actually really good at wind resistant but I guess the holes where the mouth is located lets in more cold air if you were moving at above 10mph+ speed... I would recommend for walking, snowboard,skiing, but not for motorcycle, snow mobile, or anything extreme sports in extreme conditions.

customer_reviews.title: Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: So this was purchased for riding the motorcycle when it's cold, and I have a few complaints. It does block wind BUT the area around the mouth as in the opening is far too large and wide so it just kind of hangs and falls open thusly not protecting you, and that's prior to riding the bike, so wind on the bike really blows it open. We will just stick to the 99 cent bandana over this.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, has some drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: Use this while ATVing on colder Montana mornings. Does a good job of keeping my neck and head warm, though I tend to feel quite a bit of wind on my face. My only major complaint is the mouth vent doesn't allow air to circulate out while breathing well enough to keep glasses from fogging up while wearing both at the same time. I either have to pull the face part down under my chin to wear glasses while riding, or wear the face part up and forgo glasses. This was disappointing as the appearance of a well ventilated mouth area is the only reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Malka

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as useful as the pictures advertise
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my head and face warm, but It's advertised as being useable with sunglasses without fogging them up. Someone forgot to tell the sunglasses... My Oakley Five.squared sunglasses as well as some tight fitting wrap-arounds fogged up/frosted up instantly. You can definitely breathe easily, and it prevents the build-up of CO2 that can happen with some balaclavas, but don't expect to see where you're going if you have to wear this and sunglasses on a sunny, frigid day.
customer_reviews.author: RCrew9

customer_reviews.title: Too tight for me
customer_reviews.text: Too tight. I wear 7-1/2 to 7-3/4 hats, and this is uncomfortably tight for me. The photos make it look as if there is a lot of room in the nose and neck areas, but there isn't. If your nose isn't flat before you wear t his, it will be afterward. From now on, I'm staying away from the one-size-fits-all products. In my experience, they are always a bad compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Jere F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Super warm and yet still breathable, great for skiing
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great hit, we got more for friends and family! It's perfectly breathable and doesn't smell funky, while also shielding my face from the wind and the cold. I use this for skiing and even in the coldest of colds, it holds up. The slit is wide enough to not cover my eyes, and the bottom is movable so you can reveal your mouth if necessary (eg for snacking).
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Super Warm Bavaclava
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, especially now that the weather is really cold, last night waiting for the train it was 7 degrees out. Wearing this the cold didnt even effect me. Easy to put on and off though with the dry air static electricity does mess up your hair but that's a small price to pay for the warmth this provides. Another - is it's not kind to those who wear glasses, on exhale your glasses fog up if you have it covering your nose. Place the bavaclava right under your nose and you should be in good shape. Look at the photo for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Hirschman

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first face mask and I loved it. I bought this to use while riding the quad. Pros: It fit perfectly around my eyes and I was able to wear regular sunglasses over the top. It is plenty warm and comfortable, too. Cons: The mouth cover has tiny holes in it for breathing. Riding behind several other quads, there was a lot of dust and it wasn't the best for keeping dust/dirt out of my mouth. To be fair, that's not what it was designed for but I noticed other brands do have a full cover over the mouth.
customer_reviews.author: wow_wow_wow

customer_reviews.title: My go-to biking balaclava
customer_reviews.text: I wear this during the winter months in my job as a bike courier. Chicago winters are notoriously bad, but this does a great job of keeping the bitter wind off my face while maintaining breathability. Keeps my head warm as well and fits perfectly under my helmet. Only caveat is that after a few hours of huffing and puffing on my bike, condensation forms around the mouth area from the fog of my breath and in cold enough temps it turns into ice. It’s really not THAT big of a problem, but it does happen. Note, however, that this probably won’t happen during walks or short runs.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, it wont fog your goggles or glasses!!!
customer_reviews.text: I using it to ride my motorcycle with a Half Helmet in cold weather. To the seller: I am shocked that you don't specify the vent at the nose/mouth level in your description. This should be one of your main selling point. I tried so many Balaclavas and bandannas to keep my face warm while riding but they all have the same issue: fogging my goggles/glasses. This product wont, you exhale straight out the vent. Other pluses: It's quite thin and warm. Fits very well under my helmet. Also fully covers my neck. After 3 years of trying multiple solutions for cold weather riding, finally found what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I have an Under Armour balaclava that I like, but was looking for something a little warmer and something that could breathe a little better without fogging up sunglasses. I ride a motorcycle daily so warmth and anti-fog are important. It's not small (extends well down into the neck), which is a plus, but aside from that... this is just ok. There's nothing really wrong with it that I could write a negative review about, but it isn't as snug fitting as I was expecting (I'm used to that Under Armour stretch material), and it seems to fog up my glasses more than with the UA balaclava. Just food for thought.
customer_reviews.author: David Thompson Jr

customer_reviews.title: One Step Beyond A Parka's Hood
customer_reviews.text: Last winter it was so cold during the ice storms. The wind was painfully cold. This rig helped in the bitter cold, however we still had to return from our winter hikes early due to cold eyes and too much moisture around the mouth area. Goggles would help a great deal unless they fog up. I wish this had a better way to allow moisture from breath to escape, however I'm going to keep this in the truck during winter - it could be enough to save my life or somebody else's life - or at least allow more comfort when chaining up.
customer_reviews.author: Alien Bitflipper

customer_reviews.title: Ninja style
customer_reviews.text: Do not wear if walking into a BANK, WORK or PUBLIC. What you can do is wear this around your house; particularly on trash night. You can roll your trash up in a rug and take it out. Majority of people will assume you have just “kicked the bucket” and were defeated by this ninja type. From then proceed to run around your house for while until the cops come to question you. And if they don’t come all your neighbors hate you. Either way worth the money. Keeps you warm on cold days
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Great modular design!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty great, especially when you consider the price. It's a very modular design, in that it can be a face mask, a neck wrap, a hat, or a full balaclava. It is very warm, a pretty comfortable on the skin. If I was gonna knock it for anything, is that it does like to fog up glasses due to lack of nose ventilation. Still, it keeps me warm and that's the most important part!
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Your Face Comfortably Warm!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly used this for work outside and honestly was the best decision I ever made. I like the material of the mask and it has a breathable mesh on the nose. I live in Minnesota and the winds can be harshly cold, but the mask does a great job at blocking that. It works great as a neck warmer too! I fold the mask down inside the neck piece and when you step outside you can quickly requip the mask. I don't use the hood that often, but it works great to keep the back of your neck warm when you tuck it inside.
customer_reviews.author: LunarRoyalty

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this item because it covers my face and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this item because it covers my face and it does what it says it does I live in Idaho and right now it's in the winter time and it is 24 degrees outside and I work Outdoors primarily and my face is not only warm it's hot inside this thing and that's what I love aboutitem because it covers my face and it does what it says it does I live in Idaho and right now it's in the winter time and it is 24 degrees outside and I work Outdoors primarily and my face is not only warm it's hot inside this thing and that's what I love about it
customer_reviews.author: Isak Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Fits well, wicks away moisture... unlike others I've used, I don't feel like I'm "cooking" in 5 minutes. Worked very well in extended exposure while using my snow blower in single-digit temps with 30-40 mph winds for at least 90 minutes. Haven't used the ability to pull the hood down and go half-baklava. Not sure I will, but it's there if I need it. :) Gives great control over how much of your eyes are exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell that didn't go away.
customer_reviews.text: The fit was fine, and it did help with the coldness factor, but there was a surprisingly strong chemical smell to it that didn't go away even after washing it. Considering that this is designed to be something that you breathe through, it was enough to make me not comfortable with continuing to use this. I found a hat and scarf combo for around the same price that was not only a lot more fashionable (and didn't make me look like I was about to rob a bank), but kept me even warmer, and didn't come with any chemical odors. If you are just looking for something to keep you warm, I would recommend getting that instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M.

customer_reviews.title: I love to walk
customer_reviews.text: I love to walk, but sometimes when the wind is on my cheeks and it isn't fun. I got this to keep the wind off my cheeks and it works great. I love that I can move the bottom part up and down, up when I need it, down when I don't or I met people. My only complaint is it makes my glasses fog up, but then I have never had a mask that didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Real Head Turner!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! This is a game changer, it sure keeps my frosty noggin warm. I wear this baby everywhere I go. I wear it when I'm doing my banking, I wear it when I pop in to the convenience store for a pack of smokes, I even wear it when I'm late for my plane at the airport and I'm dashing around with my backpack looking for my gate! It's a real head turner, the only thing is people do avoid any eye contact and they pretend to be calling someone on that new fangled "911" number on them their cellular phones. You know the ones like Captain Kirk had on that Star Wars tv show.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Danger

customer_reviews.title: Shave your head, they said. It'll be cool, they said.
customer_reviews.text: Very practical design, excellent craftsmanship. Fits my XXL sized melon just fine, despite being a bit tight around the nose. Could be worn as a full-on balaclava, or just a hat, or just a mask... or around the neck like a scarf. My only gripe is that "wind-resistant" bit in a description. There's no such thing as wind resistant polar fleece, and this one is no exception. You'll need a real windstopper to protect your head from the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great for biking in the cold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could continue to ride in colder temperatures. I have a larger head (7 3/4 fitted hat) and have no problems with fit. It does a great job at keeping your head and face warm. It is thin enough that I can still wear a winter hat on top if I want to. It does of course make it slightly harder to breathe, but that's the tradeoff for staying warm. And it's very simple to pull it down and get some air and then put it back in position. I haven't used it enough to see how long it will last, but so far no signs of any issues.
customer_reviews.author: KS87

customer_reviews.title: Tested in Boston blizzards, A++++
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! In the department stores you will pay 3x the price for similar cold weather gear and still I would argue they wouldn't be as good as this one! My husband used to waste so much money going to store that supply work gear, now he has me do all the shopping and he sees the magic that is amazon 😂. We've tested this in some New England blizzards and snow storms and it gets the job done and protects his face and head comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It's Definitely worth buying
customer_reviews.text: awesome face mask, winter cap, neck gaiter combo. not too tight, breathable and warm. Only complaint i have is the mouth piece. It's made of mesh to allow you to speak and breath properly but blasting air gets in through there and your mouth ends up cold a little bit. would have been better if they used spandex in that spot instead to serve same purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Semiera

customer_reviews.title: and certainly not as comfortable. If you pull the face portion down even ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as I had hoped, and certainly not as comfortable. If you pull the face portion down even slightly, your ears will be exposed. Look, this was a nasty winter for me, and having this certainly made it more bearable, but I really was not blown away by this at all. If I were more active outdoors in winter, I would even consider buying a different balaclava for next year, but for my purposes, this one will suffice. The fact that there was nearly a $4 price drop within 12 hours of me placing my order certainly didn't improve my view of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Temps where in the teens and I couldn't be happier with the way this preformed
customer_reviews.text: I just wore this to West Yellowstone for a couple days of snowmobiling. Temps where in the teens and I couldn't be happier with the way this preformed. The helmets were not heated and my head and neck stayed warm the entire time..... Also used this skiing at the Targhee Grand Resort in Wyoming...elevation near 10,000 feet at the top and temps pushing the single digits , the balaclava did excellent. I'm getting ready to buy another as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: Very reluctant to order this at first. With the new norm being wearing a mask... I work in a Supply Chain warehouse and while I'm running the floor, wearing this.... makes my job easy. In a room temperature warehouse, this product is entirely functional and breathable. Absorbs sweat making it a quick wash at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: JustStriving

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant in extreme conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I recently lived through the cold snap in the midwest where temperatures were dropping well below zero during the daytime. Now, I work outside for about 70% of my work day, and I bundled up in as many clothes as I could physically wear without becoming Ralphie from A Christmas Story. Anyways, I used this balaclava as my head and face covering. It performed extremely well under extreme conditions. It completely blocked the frigid wind and kept my head/face/neck in comfort. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ellery Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not so warm
customer_reviews.text: Buy because of the reviews, Hiking at 11400 with 40F temps and had my nose freezing, plus the fact that your breath is going to fog your googles if you fear any. Pros: -Neck area is the only warm side. -Can fold without problems. -Good fit -Looks good (aesthetically) Con: -Not as warm in front face area as described. I can't really recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beethoven

customer_reviews.title: Not only will you look like Scorpion from Mortal Kombat
customer_reviews.text: Up here in North Dakota we can have up to -60F with some strong wind. Last winter I had this out in -30s and it was a game changer. I don't know why I didn't buy this earlier. Not only will you look like Scorpion from Mortal Kombat, but your face and neck will stay warm like you're in the pits of hell kicking Johhny Cage's ass while listening to Fear Factory. Works great for snowblowing, especially when the wind blows mists of snow back into your face. This is a must-have addition to your winter gear
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great balaclava!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to climb Mt Kilimanjaro in July. He loved it! He wore it on summit night when you climb all night long and it's SUPER cold! It protected his head and face from the cold but allowed him to breathe through it. And breathing on Kilimanjaro on summit night is a challenge with the lack of oxygen! He said it never impeded his breathing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balaclava for harsh cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal product to use up here in Alaska. I really enjoy the design of the N-Ferno 6823 thermal fleece balaclava. I’ve been using the balaclava mainly at the dead of night while chasing the Aurora Borealis or working outside in the harsh Alaska tundra. It fits perfectly and having the ability to remove the facemask and bring it back up to your face is seamlessly. When the wind picks up, I can barely feel the tundra wind hitting my face. The average temperatures I’ve used this balaclava were in -12F to 32F (-24C to 0C). I highly recommend this product if you are working outside in the extreme cold.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Used it on my bike at 45f  Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I ride a touring bike to work in Florida and sometimes my head gets cold on the 45 min ride each way. I put this on and problems solved. It does tend to pick up lint and odds and ends but I just keep it in a plastic grocery bag in my trunk of my bike when not in use. I would buy again. Nice and warm. It doesn't seem to make my full face helmet much tighter when I wear it. If your helmet is tight this might be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great, with an addition to prevent fogging.
customer_reviews.text: This almost perfect. It is warm and I really like the breathing setup. The only problem I had is that I wear glasses and if I had the mask over my nose it caused them to fog immediately. However, I found a way to fix about 90% of that. I took a paperclip flattened out, and slid it into the hem on the bottom of the eyehole right in front of my nose. Then I bent the paperclip around the bridge of my nose and up against my cheeks. Kind of like this _/\_ shape. That keeps my breath from rising in to my glasses. I might buy another one of these just to have for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J. Raubenolt

customer_reviews.title: Cold Gear runner/walker essential!
customer_reviews.text: I am a runner throughout the year in the Northeast. I purchased the Ergodyne N-Ferno 6823 Winter Balaclava Ski Mask, Wind-Resistant Face Mask, Thermal Fleece, in Black. What a difference compared to other fleece and face/neck/head/ masks I have used in the past. - Fit is perfect for me (Large) - Ability to use with or without entire mask and hat on. - keeps me very warm in sub freezing and very windy weather - use it for running in cold rainy days too. Highly recommend this product, cannot go wrong with price and investment!
customer_reviews.author: Pixel

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised at how well this worked for the cost. Although there wasn’t much to go off in regards to sizing, it fit rather well. Snug enough to not suffocate, loose enough to to where there is little shifting. I wear a size 8 hat so this should give you a good idea of for all large head folks of how it’ll fit. Just FYI, if you try wearing glasses with it in the cold, your exhales will fog them right up!
customer_reviews.author: TcJayLee

customer_reviews.title: Fogs Glasses/Sun Glasses
customer_reviews.text: Warm and fits well but it is super aggravating because it fogs my normal eyeglasses or my sunglasses if I choose to wear my contact lenses which makes it really hard to even see. This should've been easily spotted as an issue and fixed before this first one was ever shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Sockfoot

customer_reviews.title: Fit is on the smaller side
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab/weimaraner mix but she is very tall and slender. I measured her at the area specified and she is 26". I ordered the medium and it was too small. I adjusted it to as large as it could go and there was no way it was going to work. I measured her again to make sure I didn't mess up and she was still 26". The range is supposed to go from 22"-27" and she probably needed another 1-2" before it would fit. Other than the size, I really liked the quality and color. It seemed well constructed and very sturdy. I am exchanging for a large.
customer_reviews.author: Linzy Breshears

customer_reviews.title: too thin
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be thicker. It's about as thin as a dress sock. No way this is going to keep my head warm when I'm out there blowing snow off my driveway. It also didn't fit right. The head part was too large. I could pull it down way over my forehead and over my mouth.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Effective.
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me on my trip to Colorado recently. It snowed while snowboarding and this kept my neck/face clear and warm. Can't beat the price and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfortable in the winter and in snow. I work outside at night, so this balaclava has come in handy more than once. If you wear normal glasses, your breath does tend to fog them up, but I’m pretty sure that will happen with most fabrics that go over the nose. The neck easily stays under your layers, and the nose and mouth part do pull down, however, if you want it to stay down, it tends to pull and expose your ears, and then the top part on your head starts to pull down the back. I would still recommend though. It’s very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase, I only use it when I expect to be out in severe conditions for long periods of time (in my case, ice fishing), but it works great. I do get a little bit of moisture inside the nose/mouth area but that's to be expected in -35° F. Also the condensation from my breath will travel up the sides of each nose on to my eyelashes/eyebrows and beard and freeze, but again it's kind of expected in those temps, and goggles will fix that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hoey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to breathe with, great for -20 weather.
customer_reviews.text: I used this quite a bit while working outside in a cold snap we had last winter. I wore a heavy hat over the top, but this did a great job of keeping the wind from freezing my face. It is easy to breathe through, and did not build up a lot of moisture. This is now a must have for me for cold weather. I bought a spare to keep with me in the vehicle in case anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nothing worse than a wave of snow in your face when ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. This seems to be exactly what I wanted. I knocked down the rating to 3 stars because it came with someone elses hair in it. I had to wash it first before trying it on. Kinda gross. I know this could happen if I bought it in a store but I usually dig deep into the shelf trying to get a "virgin" product that hasn't been tried on already. I was worried about not being able to return it if it didn't fit after washing but it fit well. I'll be using it to snowblow the driveway this winter. Nothing worse than a wave of snow in your face when the wind kicks up.
customer_reviews.author: Airborne

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, kind of thin
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses so a typical mask cramps my face and pushes my glasses all around. This was nice. The glasses are unimpeded. However, the material is quite thin and loose. It said "one size fits all" but I feel like it will fall down at any moment. It does keep me warm, however. Another issue is breathing. I have to blow out in a very particular way or my glasses fog over every time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Riesen

customer_reviews.title: The hinge makes this mask a winner
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses, and most winter masks hurt my face when they press my glasses to hard and close on my nose, but this mask is different. It is hinged, so I can make adjustments to it while wearing it to make it more comfortable while doing my chores or walking the dog. I'm glad I discovered it. It is warm enough on my face when the wind is blowing, which it does a lot here in Iowa. For my head, I put up my hood over this mask because the top part of the mask is not warm enough in sub-zero temps or in the wind. It's a great winter accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Goats

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: These were bought as gifts for my crew. We are often outside in cold temperatures for hours at a time and these really help to keep us covered and warm. Everyone who received one has tried it and all really liked the product and felt it helped out with windy nights and low temps. You can't go wrong adding this to your cold weather gear if you face very cold temps and wind.
customer_reviews.author: Goos

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and does its job.
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened the package, this thing looked huge. I thought I'd be swimming in it. However, it turned out to be a perfect fit for my slightly above average sized head. It spans my neck and a little past my throat, which is nice for those extra chilly days. I love the design, which makes it easy to pull the face covering down without affecting the head covering part, or vice versa. Great for cold bike commutes! 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Even in Extreme Temps.
customer_reviews.text: I live in northern Minnesota and at -24 below zero and the wind blowing 15 to 20 mph it doe the trick. Keeps your face, neck and ears warm and toasty. Don't know why I didn't get one before but it a great product. Thought that fleece would still allow the wind to get thru but it doesn't. I am totally satisfied with this. Now I have to buy my wife one so she will quit taking mine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Blake

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: Went skiing in Brian Head UT for a couple days, this was the BEST protection ever. Between this and my ski goggles, I was great to ski all day in freezing temps. It did occasionally fog up my goggles, but that might have been user error, and still worth purchasing this. Even my husband was jealous because he bought a crappier version from the gift shop for 3 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared and Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good quality face mask
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mask. It got me through the winter of 17-18, including the barrage of nor'easters every week in March. My only complaint, and only reason I docked a star, is because the nose spot isn't quite tight enough which causes the sides of the nose to get cold. I tried combining it with a pair of ski goggles, however the gap then causes my breathing to fog up the goggles. That being said, it was not a huge issue and I would still definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: SirFrankoman

customer_reviews.title: Not for skiing
customer_reviews.text: There's a thin strip in the middle designed to allow easier breathing. It goes from your nose almost to the bottom of your neck. Unfortunately it quickly gets wet from your breath then freezes. I got frost nip on my neck skin with it today. Probably fine for waiting at a bus stop.
customer_reviews.author: tech guy dm

customer_reviews.title: This is a great hat for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hat for cold weather. I like how the top portion folds down over the bottom, so that it provides additional warmth for the ears. The bottom part is a little bit "wiggly" and I wonder if it would be helpful to have a nosepiece included to hold it more firmly in place. It just may be a matter of getting used to the feel and adjusting it as needed. Overall, this product is exactly what my husband and I were looking for for the outdoors. Walking our dogs is no longer a freezing experience, even with the wind and with the typically single digits morning temperatures where we live.
customer_reviews.author: L. BROOKS

customer_reviews.title: Warm, useful head and face covering especially for hunters
customer_reviews.text: I love this head and face warming unit. It is warm and useful in the harsh cold environment of the northeast USA. It will function well in the winter when I go hunting for deer which requires long waits in a blind, facing cold winds and sometimes blizzard conditions.I think you, too, will find this face and head covering so helpful in any winter conditions. .....I recommend it if you live in any cold climate...and spend prolonged time in the cold outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Jr

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: my husband , kid. and i all love this. keeps warm and good quality. i wish they made them shorter for people who have short necks but even tho its still not too bad for getting used to all the material between the chin n chest. wish it came in more colors. still very happy with this product. thank you for making it so well. yes i bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
